qas.question: Which country enjoyed the most success in battles in North America in 1759

answers.text: All of Britain's campaigns against New France succeeded in 1759

qas.question: What two forts fell on the same day in 1758?

answers.text: Fort Niagara and Fort Carillon on 8 July 1758 fell to sizable British forces

qas.question: When did General Wolfe take Quebec?

answers.text: On 13 September 1759, following a three-month siege of Quebec, General James Wolfe defeated the French

qas.question: Did the French take Quebec back?

answers.text: they were unable to retake Quebec

qas.question: What military advantage brought the success for the British in defending Quebec?

context: <a0_0>All of Britain's campaigns against New France succeeded in 1759<a0_0/>, part of what became known as an Annus Mirabilis. <a1_0>Fort Niagara and Fort Carillon on 8 July 1758 fell to sizable British forces<a1_0/>, cutting off French frontier forts further west. <a2_0>On 13 September 1759, following a three-month siege of Quebec, General James Wolfe defeated the French<a2_0/> on the Plains of Abraham outside the city. The French staged a counteroffensive in the spring of 1760, with initial success at the Battle of Sainte-Foy, but <a3_0>they were unable to retake Quebec<a3_0/>, due to <a4_0>British naval superiority<a4_0/> following the battle of Neuville. The French forces retreated to Montreal, where on 8 September they surrendered to overwhelming British numerical superiority.
